Bob and all,
Thanks.  I set up the list to not allow attachments.  I don't know if it's
possible to post non-photo files on the group website.  With a small group,
mailing out the spreadsheet individually isn't a problem.

I'm the owner/moderator, although I'm not running the list in "moderated
mode" where I would actually approve posts.  I'm hoping that we can enjoy an
open discussion of swords and fittings here without going crazy.

Several people have had comments or questions about membership.  When I sent
out the email about the list last night, I scrolled through my address book
for the people who I thought might be interested.  If anyone has friends
that are serious about the subject and can play well with others, please
invite them to join.  I don't want to make this a closed list, but I'd
rather not go out and advertise just yet so please hold off with the web
links for now.

I'd like to hear any thoughts about how to maintain a successful list --
just  be sure to respond off line to me at jggilbert@... rather
than to the whole list.
Jim


> Why not just post the excell spreadsheet to the list
> so members can get it from there and you don't have to
> keep emailing it to everyone. Just a suggestion..
>
> Bob R
>
> BTW Who's the moderator for this list? And would said
> moderator mind if I posted the link to my website in
> the links section? Thought I'd ask first.
>
